DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Sample Normal Control Extracted DNA Source Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the type of normal control sample used for DNA extraction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Sample Normal Control Extracted DNA Source
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI)_The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another._A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance._A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information._Source; where something is available.

Concepts.definition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance.:A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information. :Source; where something is available.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
Where something is available or from where it originates.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 1/20/12 Versioned to change OC from Tumor Tissue to Tissue Sample per request by Tara. mc 12/30/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means._A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information._Source; where something is available._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek.: A tuft of material on the end of a stick for applying solutions and suspensions

Concepts.definition: The surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek.
A tuft of material on the end of a stick for applying solutions and suspensions

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI): An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

Concepts.definition: The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
Where something is available or from where it originates.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
